briefTitle: 6-Month Extension Trial of Asenapine With Olanzapine in Negative Symptom Patients Who Completed the Protocol 25543 (25544)(P05777)
officialTitle: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Flexible-Dose, 6-Month Extension Trial Comparing the Safety and Efficacy of Asenapine With Olanzapine in Subjects Who Completed the Protocol 25543 (NCT 00212836; P05817)
summary:
This is an extension study to further test

the efficacy and safety of asenapine compared with a

marketed agent (olanzapine) in the treatment of patients with

persistent negative symptoms of schizophrenia.

primaryOutcome.measure: Long-term Change in Negative Symptoms of Schizophrenia Measured by the Negative Symptom Assessment (NSA) Scale
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline of Protocol 25543 (NCT 00212836) to 365 days (total time for both protocols 25543 & 25544)
